caption: I’ve tried a bunch of different pho places and this one happened to be across a good boba place I just found, so I tried it out afterwards! Had very good flavor and a friendly lady helping us out who seems to maybe be the owner. Tastes traditional, Will be returning! Delicious 😋 good prices!
Tiny unassuming place, good pho, good price, open late on Sunday.
Best pho I’ve had in a long time. Don’t skip

THE ABSOLUTE BEST Pho I have ever had on Island and oh I have sampled pho places over the last 11 years! Also you can NOT beat the owner! Such a sweet, lovely Kind woman! PLEASE be good to her if you come here she’s a one woman show, please respect her talent and perseverance through COVID. 💕❤️
Restaurant is small but the food is amazing!
Good vives

Saw this place on a Facebook Support page and decided to drop in. For me, pho falls into the category of “comfort food.” It’s simply good food, good price, good service. You have wooden chopsticks (which I prefer), stacks of condiments on the table with napkins, spoons, and small dishes. This place fit that category so perfectly, all it needed was extreme limited seating... DONE!  This next part may sound like I’m dissing the place, but hear me out. The food was Good... not GREAT!!! But that’s exactly what I was looking for. Her summer roll was actually the perfect size for a dip of peanut sauce... not too big (& it’s true that bigger is NOT always better 😂) and not too small. The soup was hot and satisfying and her compliment of basil, peppers, and bean sprouts was the right balance to the soup. The right food for a rainy day.  Some people may say I’m trying too hard to make this place sound good. For me it comes down to this... I walked in with set expectations that were met. Should I expect any more?

Just ordered from Uber ears had to wait over an hr for my order my pho was not hit just warm portion for 16.99 is very small I got 2 meatballs which was sad and had no lime/lemon wedges at all and a 2 dollar can of Pepsi which should only be 50 cents or a dollar at most thinking I’m getting a bottled Pepsi! Won’t be ordering from them again

We mostly eat a vegan diet and we’ve had so much trouble finding places that will make a vegan Pho version. Well we found some fantastic vegan options there tonight. The vegetable pho and the lemongrass dishes were so delicious. The little gal who owns and runs this place is so sweet. We really enjoyed her hospitality and we’ll be back again!
Good food
Great Place! Huge portions!!
Nice mom and pop shop that serves up a mean bowl of pho! Highly recommended!
The pork plate (com suong) plate #37 on the menu is SO GOOD. Their pho broth has great flavor too 😋

I ordered the #21 rare beef pho and was very disappointed.  To start off the meat does not come raw!  They put it into the soup for you.  It is tough and chewy and taste way over cooked.  How do you call this a “rare” beef pho when nothing is rare about it.  The reason this review gets 1 star is because they use CHICKEN STOCK.  It taste like something you would get out of a can.  It’s supposed to be a beef noodle soup common guys get it right.  The chicken completely distracts from the flavor of the beef.  It’s too confusing for my taste buds.  If I paid $6-$8 for this I would be satisfied.  There are plenty of other pho restaurants in the area that charge the same amount or less and make fresh Beef Stock, give you fresh raw meat, jalapeños, lime, chili oil, etc.  If you want to charge the same price as the competition you have to bring it up to their standard at a minimum.  I will never be returning here.  I am so disappointed and feel like I just got duped out of $15
My grandma is from Vietnam and I grew up with her cooking. That being said, I cant find any place that makes food any closer to hers.
Great food hard working people. Thank you!

Gave this new little hole in the wall place a try.  Ordered BBQ Pork Bun.  Was very disappointed with the pork.  It was very stale, cold and old.  Probably couple days old.  Definitely not cooked when ordered!  The vegetables and sauce was good though.  Might be a while if I would decide to give this place a try again.  Hopefully cook will correct this!
The portions of her servings is alot and it's very rich and tasty.
Came in to get summer rolls. Run by a very sweet lady, the food was very yummy and the price you can't beat.
I have been to so many Pho places so you can say I am a Pho expert. i have tried countless Pho places in countless number of cities, and this place really stands out. I am lucky to have found it.
Fantastic Pho with house made broth, quick and friendly service, and plenty of nail and bean sprouts on the side.  We loved it!
Fresh food. Great Pho. Nice people too.
New Pho place in town, it's fantastic and the hostess is super nice!

Saw this place while walking down the street and noticed their sign for anything $10.99.  At that price, I had to try it.  For the very reasonable price, I must say, I got a really generous bowl of Pho that was tasty and loaded.  The place is clean, well lighted, and the service was friendly as well as fast.  Going to have to hit this place up again for sure.  Can't go wrong with the price and what you got for it was great especially if you are on a budget and hungry.  The menu does focus pretty much on Pho, but there are some other options.  Nothing exotic or particularly unique, but you will find something you want to eat on the menu to match your mood.  There were a few odd menu items that seemed a bit non Vietnamese, but they are probably just trying to offer a variety.  I plan to check them out again.

Pretty decent place to get pho. They have an opening special for 10.99 One issue is having to look for parking in the lot.  It shares space with a lot of other restaurants.  Remember to get your parking validated.

Great little place for those late night vietnamese cravings. Owner is very kind and courteous, place is clean and well kept. Portions are good, maybe could have used a bit more meat in the combination pho I ordered. The flavor of the broth was tasty and the meat was tender. Really enjoyed the spring rolls! My wife enjoyed the BBQ chicken with Vermicelli bowl, (heads up there are mint leaves shredded up in the bottom for those that don't care for mint.) Price was $10.99 ( opening pricing) for entrees and $8.99 for spring rolls, which is not bad for portioning and quality of food and presentation. Overall my wife and I enjoyed a nice quiet dinner with great service and quality food, definitely recommend it!

This is my new favorite Vietnamese restaurant on the island. I was born and raised in Vietnam for 15 years so I can guarantee the quality is very close to home. My review is unbiased and honest.  I ordered a rice vermicelli with bbq chicken and pork. Very tasty and well seasoned. It also comes with bean sprout and herbs underneath. The sweet fish sauce brings in more flavor.  I also ordered 2 tofu rolls for my grandma. She is a vegetarian. She said it was ok not as good.  Friendly owner. Right now they have special price $10.99 on most items. I don't know when he prices going to chabge but definitely worth a try. Hopefully they stay consistent with the quality!
The broth and service was good but they don't give very much meat in the pho.
They prepare their pho broth/soup from scratch, for 18 hours! Finished all the soup :) Great food, very nice service, clean place. Will come again for sure!
Me and my husband loved it here, very clean and yummy pho! Great service.
